title: 106_hr4644
content: The "Fair Credit Reporting Act Amendments of 2000" allow consumers to request a free credit report annually from consumer reporting agencies. This amendment also requires the disclosure of a World Wide Web site. SEC. 3. Amends the Fair Credit Reporting Act to require consumer reporting agencies to disclose a World Wide Web site for consumer contact. SEC. 4. Requires disclosure of credit scores and explanations. SEC. 4 amends the Fair Credit Reporting Act to require disclosure of credit scores and explanations, including a summary of how scores are derived, factors considered, their application to the consumer, weight of each factor, and how factors impact the score. SEC. 5 introduces a shorter period for inclusion of small debts under certain conditions in the Fair Credit Reporting Act. It allows for exclusion of accounts with debts under $100 that are more than 3 years old if the consumer completed a credit and financial management class during that period and has not previously had an account excluded under this provision. SEC. 6 requires prompt investigation and correction or deletion of inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable consumer information. The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System and the Federal Trade Commission are required to review and monitor consumer reporting agencies and furnishers of consumer information to ensure compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. They must submit a progress report to Congress within 6 months on the results of this review. The report under subsection (b) will include recommendations for legislative or administrative action to ensure prompt investigation and correction of consumer disputes with reporting agencies, compliance by furnishers of information, and establishment of internal controls by reporting agencies. The report will recommend legislative or administrative action to ensure compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, including internal controls for prompt investigation and correction of consumer disputes. Definitions for "consumer", "consumer report", and "consumer reporting agency" are as per the Act. The amendments made by this Act will take effect 90 days after the enactment date.
